NewsLines.HeadLine: Nigeria's oil minister fined for ignoring summons: report

DataContent.p: Nigeria's oil minister and former OPEC chief has been fined 4,000 naira (27 dollars, 21.5 euros) for ignoring a summons to appear before a special Senate panel, a local daily said on Wednesday.
Rilwanu Lukman, 70, was last month asked to address a Senate committee on the oil sector reforms, but failed to do so.
Senator Lee Maeba said had it not been for his age and status, the Senate would have raised a warrant of arrest against the minister, according to The Guardian.
The fine, imposed on Tuesday, represents the cost of conveying the summons to the minister.

"I did not neglect or refuse to attend the meeting... as I have made excuses," the former secretary general of the international oil cartel, the Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC), was quoted as saying.
It was the first time since Nigeria returned to civilian rule in 1999 that a senior government official would be so sanctioned.
